Yume Ga Arukara Review | Bon Appetit

The team makes everything in-house, from the intensely meaty broth to the squiggly noodles, and each bowl is perfectly calibrated with a splash of hot broth, a mound of noodles, a scattering of scallions, some grated daikon, and a lemon slice for the most satisfying udon you’ll ever eat.THE VIBE IS: very Tokyo. The tiny noodle counter has has that same handmade feel with wood desk-like seating made by Nishioka’s wife, an aspiring carpenter. It has that kind of intimate, convivial atmosphere you’d find at a yakitori stall. Even though it’s hidden in a Japanese food court at Lesley College, you won’t miss it. Lines form early before the shop opens, so prepare yourself accordingly.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open Tuesday through Thursday, 5 p.m. to 9 p.m., and Friday and Saturday, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. and 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Closed Sunday and Monday.
